alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 4:44AM CDT until August 05 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kansas, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baxter Springs, Columbus, Galena, West Mineral, Lowell, Sherman, Roseland, Stippville, Skidmore, Sherwin, Carona, Neutral, Hallowell, Crestline and Riverton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
